Title:
The phylogenetic position of an Armillaria species from
Amami-Oshima, a subtropical island of Japan, based on elongation factor
and ITS sequences
Keywords:
Armillaria novae-zelandiae  Elongation factor-1α
phylogenetic analysis, ITS
Abstract:
An undetermined Armillaria species was collected on
Amami-Oshima, a subtropical island of Japan. The phylogenetic position
of the Armillaria sp. was determined using sequences of the elongation
factor-1α (EF-1α) gene and the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region
(ITS1-5.8S-ITS2) of rDNA. The phylogenetic analyses based on EF-1α and
ITS sequences showed that this species differs from known Japanese
Armillaria spp. The sequences of this species and ‘A. novae-zelandiae’
from Southeast Asia were contained in a strongly supported clade, which
was adjacent to a well-supported sister clade containing A.
novae-zelandiae from Australia and New Zealand.
